docs.snippet: With each scripted speech, shift in policy and attempt to whitewash his past behavior, Donald Trump is brazenly betting that voters now settling on their choice for president are willing to shove aside all that came before his late-in-the-campaign...
docs.lead_paragraph: With each scripted speech, shift in policy and attempt to whitewash his past behavior, Donald Trump is brazenly betting that voters now settling on their choice for president are willing to shove aside all that came before his late-in-the-campaign recalibration.

headline.main: Trump Glosses Over Past Actions, and Hopes Voters Do Same
headline.print_headline: Trump Glosses Over Past Actions, and Hopes Voters Do Same

docs.snippet: An election analysis conducted in the Reuters/Ipsos States of the Nation project shows that the race has tightened considerably over the past few weeks, with Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump projected to win Florida, an essential battl...
docs.lead_paragraph: An election analysis conducted in the Reuters/Ipsos States of the Nation project shows that the race has tightened considerably over the past few weeks, with Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump projected to win Florida, an essential battleground state, if the election were held today.

headline.main: Race Tightens in Projected U.S. Electoral College Vote: Reuters/Ipsos
headline.print_headline: Race Tightens in Projected U.S. Electoral College Vote: Reuters/Ipsos

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama said Saturday night he will take it as a "personal insult" if the African-American community fails to turn out for the presidential election and encouraged black voters to support Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama said Saturday night he will take it as a "personal insult" if the African-American community fails to turn out for the presidential election and encouraged black voters to support Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton.

headline.main: Obama Urges African-American Voters to Protect His Legacy
headline.print_headline: Obama Urges African-American Voters to Protect His Legacy

docs.snippet: U.S. Republican vice presidential candidate Mike Pence released a letter from his doctor on Saturday declaring Donald Trump's running mate was in "excellent" health....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Republican vice presidential candidate Mike Pence released a letter from his doctor on Saturday declaring Donald Trump's running mate was in "excellent" health.

headline.main: Republican VP Candidate Pence in 'Excellent' Health: Doctor
headline.print_headline: Republican VP Candidate Pence in 'Excellent' Health: Doctor

docs.snippet: Black voters are reacting skeptically to Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump's admission that he now believes the nation's first black president was indeed born in the United States. Many say the fact that Trump spent years questioning Pr...
docs.lead_paragraph: Black voters are reacting skeptically to Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump's admission that he now believes the nation's first black president was indeed born in the United States. Many say the fact that Trump spent years questioning President Barack Obama's national origin was disrespectful, and an insult to all black Americans.

headline.main: Trump's Birther Flip Meets With Skepticism From Many Blacks
headline.print_headline: Trump's Birther Flip Meets With Skepticism From Many Blacks
